meanings.definition: A person who is lazy and avoids work.
meanings.sent1: The layabout always sleeps in and never helps with chores.
meanings.sent2: My brother is such a layabout, he never lifts a finger to help around the house.
meanings.sent3: The layabout thought he could avoid work by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent4: The village layabout was like a shadow, always present but never contributing.
meanings.sent5: The lazy layabout lounged on the couch all day, ignoring his responsibilities.

meanings.definition: To spend time doing nothing or being lazy.
meanings.sent1: I just want to layabout on the beach and relax all day.
meanings.sent2: After a long week, I like to layabout and do nothing on Sundays.
meanings.sent3: She decided to layabout instead of finishing her homework, but regretted it later.
meanings.sent4: The cat loves to layabout in the sun, basking in its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The old dog would layabout in the shade, enjoying the cool breeze.
